website_summaries.verdict: The latest Surface Pro tablet doesn't make any radical design changes, but the performance jump makes it viable as a mainstream performance laptop replacement.
pros: The Surface Pro 6's jump to new quad-core processors pays off in big performance gains
The new black color option looks cool
Still the best kickstand and keyboard for Windows tablets
cons: Be ready to shell out extra for the keyboard cover, stylus and even for the new matte black design
CPU and color aside, it's a very minimal upgrade over the previous version

customer_reviews.title: It's not Google
customer_reviews.text: I had been trying to use a google tablet and all I got was ads and disappointment. every time I tried to look something up it would bring up another ad, then another. Battery life was okay - but who wants to shift through ads all day - not me. So I read about the Surface Pro 6 - my son-in-law has a Pro 4 I think and he loved his so I decided - why not. I ordered it and have totally been satisfied with every aspect of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Seems scary - but its worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy a new computer to help adapt to the stay at home orders (thank you COVID19) and was not sure what I wanted. Since everything was closed/curbside only I turned to our beloved AMAZON for help and did not come up empty handed! I know that it seems like a lot of money for a product you can only hope will be everything you need, but its worth it! I am a medical student and spend nearly 10 hours a day using a computer for classes/homework and this computer has held its battery life and not had any glitches/malfunctions for the 2.5 months that I have had it! I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: With a temporary demise of a trusted upscale laptop and several pending work-related deadlines involving travel, I needed a good, reliable, Windows based laptop/tablet. The Surface Pro 6 fit the criterion of price and operating systems (and hence support for my usual programs), but would it meet my work needs? Actually, it has exceeded needs and expectations - everything loaded easily, synced across platforms. has a wonderful detachable keyboard, and compared to my other laptop it has amazing (!) battery life. Screen image is vivid and clear - touchscreen responsive - unit feels solid but not overly big. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Becker

customer_reviews.title: Love my pro
customer_reviews.text: I got this for work so I could work from home. Pros: It’s very fast, easy to use, good battery life, lite weight, very slim, keyboard is easy to use and flips up to become a cover. Screen resolution is beautiful. Power plug is very easy to plug in. This is the latest revision of surface pro 6 with a recent manufacturer date. Cons: The screen is a little smaller then what I’m used to and there isn’t a 10 key. One USB port, no HDMI port
customer_reviews.author: jLaDy

customer_reviews.title: factory damaged hinge ruining screen
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my college son. He loves it however, a hinge has a factory defect and it's gotten looser. It puts pressure on the screen distorting it. The seller was not helpful. I'm in the process of trying to get service from the warranty I purchased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Baby B, Keeler twin

customer_reviews.title: Surface "Pro" should not have Windows HOME
customer_reviews.text: I keep ordering Surface Pro and getting Windows Home OS If I wanted Windows Home, I would order a regular Surface. How the does a Surface "Pro" wind up with Windows Home? You can't join Windows Home to a domain, so it has no application in a business environment.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Walters
